Multivalued field associated with all the other fields in the file to give details of a portfolio position. This field will contain the cost of the position. The actual calculation done for this field will depend on the type of position this set of values represents.
The value of this field is calculated in a similar way to the COST.PRICE field but using value dated positions.

If the position is for a security then this figure contains the calculated cost for a single security in the security currency. It is calculated using the VALUE.DATED.COST field from the SECURITY.POSITION record that gave rise to this entry on the SC.POS.ASSET file. It is calculated as follows ;
COST.PRICE = (VD.COST * PERC.FACTOR) / (VD.NOMINAL * MULT.FACTOR)

Where VD.COST is the value contained in the VALUE.DATED.COST field on the SECURITY.POSITION record. PERC.FACTOR is 100 if the Security price is expressed in percentage terms (found from the PRICE.TYPE record associated with the security) and 1 otherwise. MULT.FACTOR is the multiplication factor for the security (found from the PRICE.TYPE record associated with the security). VD.NOMINAL is the value dated nominal balance found from the SECURITY.POSITION record field VALUE.DATED.POSN. If the position is built from more than one SECURITY.POSITION record then the COST.PRICE is pro-rated.

If the position is for a FOREX contract then this field will contain the exchange rate of the deal (if the portfolio reference currency is one of the currencies involved in the deal) or the market or forward rate between the currency in the associated SECURITY.CCY value and the portfolio reference currency at the time of the original contract. It is retained as the cost price until the contact matures and is removed from the portfolio valuation.
If the position is for a Forward Rate Agreement then this field will contain the value in the INTEREST.RATE field of the original contract.
If the position is for an Account then this field will be blank.
If the position is for a Money Market contract or for a Loans and Deposits contract then this field will be blank.
If the position is for a Fiduciary contract then this field will be blank.
If the position is for a Miscellaneous Deal then this field will be blank.

If the position is for a Derivative contract then this field contains the cost for Value dated positions. The Cost price is calculated the same way as COST.PRICE but only for value dated positions. For options with premium paid up front

This field is a multi-valued field associated with all the other fields in this file. It is only updated is the set of values associated with this particular value are for a security position otherwise this field will be blank.

If the position concerned is for a security then this field will contain the gross cost price for a single security expressed in the security currency of the security (which will be the security in the associated SECURITY.CCY field). It is calculated using the GROSS.COST.SEC.CCY field from the SECURITY.POSITION record represented by this set of values. It is calculated as follows ;

GROSS.COST = (COST.INVST * PERC.FACTOR) / (NOMINAL * MULT.FACTOR) Where COST.INVST is the value contained in the GROSS.COST.SEC.CCY field on the SECURITY.POSITION record. PERC.FACTOR is 100 if the Security price is expressed in percentage terms (found from the PRICE.TYPE record associated with the security) and 1 otherwise. MULT.FACTOR is the multiplication factor for the security (found from the PRICE.TYPE record associated with the security). NOMINAL is the closing nominal balance found from the SECURITY.POSITION record field CLOSING.BAL.NO.NOM. If the position is built from more than one SECURITY.POSITION record then the gross cost price is pro-rated.

Multivalued field associated with all the other fields in the file to give details of a portfolio position. This field contains a percentage figure equating to the yield of the position.
This figure contains different data depending on the module that gave rise to the portfolio position;
If the position has been generated from a Fiduciary contract (FD) the this field will contain the INTEREST.RATE from the FD.FID.ORDER record that gave rise to the position.
If this position has been generated from a LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS (LD) contract then this field is taken from the INTEREST.RATE field on the LOANS.AND.DEPOSIT record that gave rise to the position.
If this position has been generated from a MONEY.MARKET (MM) contract then this field is taken from the INTEREST.RATE field on the MONEY.MARKET record that gave rise to the position.

If this position has been generated from a Security Position then if the Security giving rise to the position is a share then this field will be updated from the PROCE.EARN.RATIO field on the SECURITY.SUPP record for the security. If the security is a bond then this field will be populated from the YIELD.TO.MAT field in the SECURITY.SUPP record for the bond. If the YIELD.TO.MAY figure is blank then it will calculate a yield using the Interest Rate from the SECURITY.MASTER record for the bond and the cost price for the position.

If this position has been generated from a Swap (SW) contract then this field is taken from the INTEREST.RATE field from the SWAP.BALANCES record, of the side of the SWAP transaction represented by this set of fields.

For DX holds the amount that the price of an option changes compared to a 1% change in volatility.

Vega changes when there are large price movements in the underlying asset and vega falls as the option gets closer to maturity. Vega can change even if there is no change in the price of the underlying asset, this would happen if there is a change in expected volatility.

For DX, holds a measure of the rate of decline in the value of an option due to the passage of time. Theta can also be referred to as the time decay on the value of an option. If everything is held constant, then the option will lose value as time moves closer to the maturity of the option.
Theta is part of the group of measures known as the "Greeks" (other measures include delta, gamma and vega) which are used in options pricing

If the position is for a Foreign Exchange (FX) contract then this field will either contain either the bought or sold currency from the FOREX contract, from either the CURRRENCY.BOUGHT or CURRENCY.SOLD fields. When a Forex contract is recorded on the T24 Portfolio management system then the bought and sold sides are recorded separately. This is because the value of the contract to the portfolio depends on the exchange rates of the individual currencies on the deal against the reference currency of the portfolio at the time of the contract and at the time of rebuilding the portfolio valuation data. The value is then the difference (i.e. revaluation using the rebate method).

If this position is a Derivatives Position (DX) then this fields is the current of the transaction DX.TRANSACTION.

Multivalued field associated with all the other fields in the file to give details of a portfolio position. This field is only updated if the portfolio position is for an interest bearing security. In which case it is worked out from the formula;
GR.YIELD = INT.RATE + ((100 - GR.COST.PRICE) * (INT.RATE / 100))
Where; INT.RATE is the interest rate taken from the SECURITY.MASTER record for the security. GR.COST.PRICE is the gross cost price of the security position.

This field contains a Margin value for the portfolio position. If the position is a debit or a short position then this field will be equal to the associated ESTIMATION field. Otherwise this field will contain a value calculated by multiplying the ESTIMATION amount by the Margin Rate for the position.

For all positions other than Securities (SC) and Fiduciaries (FD) then the Margin Rate will come from the MARGIN.RATE field in the ASSET.BY.CATEG record for the CATEGORY of the position - if there is one - and then default to the MARGIN.RATE field on the ASSET.TYPE record the position is linked to if there is no ASSET.BY.CATEG record. If the margin rate has not been entered on either of these files a rate os 0 is used.

If the position is for a Fiduciary (FD) contract then the system will first try to find the margin rate from the ASSET.BY.CATEG file, then use the MARGIN.RATE field on the FD.FID.ORDER record before finally using the ASSET.TYPE record if a margin rate has not been set-up on either of the other files.

If the position is for a Securities (SC) contract then the system will first see if there is a MARGIN.CONTROL record connected to the SECURITY.MASTER record for the Security. If there is the margin rate will be taken from the MARGIN.CONTROL record. If there is no MARGIN.CONTROL record connected to the Security then the margin rate will be taken from the MARGIN.RATE field of the SUB.ASSET.TYPE record the position is connected to.

Multivalued field associated with all the other fields in the file to give details of a portfolio position. This field will contain the cost of the position. The actual calculation done for this field will depend on the type of position this set of values represents.

If the position is for a security then this figure contains the calculated cost for a single security in the security currency. It is calculated using the COST.INVST.SEC.CCY from the SECURITY.POSITION record that gave rise to this entry on the SC.POS.ASSET file. It is calculated as follows ;
COST.PRICE = (COST.INVST * PERC.FACTOR) / (NOMINAL * MULT.FACTOR)

Where COST.INVST is the value contained in the COST.INVST.SEC.CCY field on the SECURITY.POSITION record. PERC.FACTOR is 100 if the Security price is expressed in percentage terms (found from the PRICE.TYPE record associated with the security) and 1 otherwise. MULT.FACTOR is the multiplication factor for the security (found from the PRICE.TYPE record associated with the security). NOMINAL is the closing nominal balance fould from the SECURITY.POSITION record field CLOSING.BAL.NO.NOM. If the position is built from more than one SECURITY.POSITION record then the COST.PRICE is pro-rated.

If the position is for a FOREX contract then this field will contain the exchange rate of the deal (if the portfolio reference currency is one of the currencies involved in the deal) or the market or forward rate between the currency in the associated SECURITY.CCY value and the portfolio reference currency at the time of the original contract. It is retained as the cost price until the contact matures and is removed from the portfolio valuation.
If the position is for a Forward Rate Agreement then this field will contain the value in the INTEREST.RATE field of the original contract.
If the position is for an Account then this field will be blank.
If the position is for a Money Market contract or for a Loans and Deposits contract then this field will be blank.
If the position is for a Fiduciary contract then this field will be blank.
If the position is for a Miscellaneous Deal then this field will be blank.
If this position is for a Derivatives transactions then this is the price for one lot of this contract.
For derivatives it has three parametric set up given detailed below.
Positional
Futures - Cost price is the weighted average of all the buy and sell price taken together

Options - when PREM.POST.TIME is 'TRADE' cost price is the weighted average of all buy prices alone if the buy lots are more than the sell lots, else weighted average of all sell prices if the sell lots are more than BUY lots. in case PREM.POST.TIME is 'SETTLEMENT' it will behave as future contract
BUY.SELL.POS
Cost price is multi-value field with the weighted average of all buy transactions as one and weighted average of all sell transactions as another field
Transactional
Cost price will be shown transaction wise for each transaction as a multi-value field. Here for each transaction, cost price will be same as the price.
